entries.title: United States Grand Prix: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz and Charles Leclerc head practice sessions
entries.description: Ferrari drivers Carlos Sainz and Charles Leclerc headed the two Friday practice sessions at the United States Grand Prix in Austin, Texas.

entries.title: Brendan Gleeson and Colin Farrell reunite in new comedy
entries.description: Brendan Gleeson and Colin Farrell star in The Banshees of Inisherin, Martin McDonagh's new comedy.

entries.title: China congress: How one man on a bridge marred Xi Jinping's big moment
entries.description: The striking protest tapped into a vein of discontent, leaving an enduring legacy in Chinese dissent.

entries.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Boris breaks silence' and 'Rishi remains favourite'
entries.description: Boris Johnson flying back from holiday and more MPs backing Rishi Sunak in the Tory leadership race make the lead for several papers.

entries.title: Cost of living: Port Talbot mum's debt drove her to the brink
entries.description: Mum Julie Andrews ignored gas, electric and council tax bills and got loans to buy school uniform.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Australia's Josh Addo-Carr on 'turning life around'
entries.description: Emerging as a star of the World Cup, Australia's Josh Addo-Carr explains how his life could have been so different.

entries.title: Moody's: UK's economic outlook now 'negative', ratings agency says
entries.description: Political instability and high inflation in the country means it is less likely to pay back debts, the ratings agency says.

entries.title: Whale's majestic move brings dramatic end to marine rescue off Canada
entries.description: A marine crew battled for hours to free a humpback whale from fishing gear. Then they watched in awe as the giant did this.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak leads PM race as Boris Johnson flies back to London
entries.description: Allies of the ex-chancellor say he has 100 nominations, as Mr Johnson heads home from the Caribbean.

entries.title: Newport: Man caught on CCTV kicking cat against wall
entries.description: The 19-year-old pet named Tinker was left limping after the man put the boot in.

entries.title: Moment of the tournament? 'Hot-dog' pass sets up 'world class' Australia try in Rugby League World Cup
entries.description: Watch as Australia's Matt Burton performs a one-handed through-the-legs pass to set up Josh Addo-Carr for his fourth try.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Australia thrash Scotland 84-0
entries.description: Holders Australia thrashed sorry Scotland 84-0 in Coventry, all but confirming their spot in the Rugby League World Cup knockout stages.

entries.title: Hibernian 1-2 St Johnstone: Visitors' comeback stuns hosts after Kyle Magennis red card
entries.description: St Johnstone come from behind to beat Hibernian at Easter Road as VAR enjoyed a controversy-free introduction to the Scottish Premiership.

entries.title: Josephine Melville: Ex-EastEnders actress dies backstage after play
entries.description: Josephine Melville fell ill after performing in a production at Nottingham Playhouse.

entries.title: Ukraine war: 'I'd rather go to jail than fight in Ukraine', Russian man says
entries.description: Russia has mobilised many thousands of men to fight in Ukraine. But Mikhail Ashichev refuses to go.

entries.title: Trump subpoena: Former president ordered to testify to January 6 committee
entries.description: If Mr Trump does not comply with the subpoena he could face criminal charges and imprisonment.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Team-by-team guide and predictions before Super 12 begins
entries.description: BBC Sport analyses the remaining teams in the T20 World Cup and makes predictions as the tournament reaches the Super 12 phase.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ben Stokes says boundary sponges should be smaller after Reece Topley injury
entries.description: The size of boundary sponges is "stupid" and "should be looked at" after England bowler Reece Topley's ankle injury, says Ben Stokes.

entries.title: Tory leadership: How secure is the online vote?
entries.description: There are concerns about security if the Tory leadership is decided by an online ballot of party members.

entries.title: Steve Bannon sentencing: Jail term shows January 6 risks for Trump
entries.description: This sentence for contempt of Congress comes as Donald Trump faces a subpoena from the same committee.

entries.title: Penny Mordaunt: A very quick guide to the rising star who might be PM
entries.description: Penny Mordaunt may not have the name recognition of her rivals, but has been on the rise.

entries.title: Ed Sheeran: Hacker who stole singer's unreleased music is jailed
entries.description: Adrian Kwiatkowski offered the songs in exchange for cryptocurrency on the dark web.

entries.title: Lucy Letby trial: Unusual finding in baby's X-ray, court hears
entries.description: A doctor tells a court of his findings after examining a baby allegedly murdered by nurse Lucy Letby.

entries.title: Jair Bolsonaro: Why the world is watching Brazil's election
entries.description: Some say the future of the largest rainforest in the world depends on who becomes Brazil's president.

entries.title: Ukraine war: US and Russian defence ministers discuss Ukraine in rare talks
entries.description: Lloyd Austin spoke with his Russian counterpart Sergei Shoigu for the second time since the war began.

entries.title: Penny Mordaunt: Brexiteer popular with Tory the grassroots
entries.description: A profile of the Commons leader, the first person to declare they are running for the Tory leadership.

entries.title: The downfall of Steve Bannon
entries.description: Steve Bannon, a right-wing media personality-turned-Trump adviser, is back in court once again.

entries.title: Steve Bannon verdict: Ex Trump adviser sentenced to four months in jail for contempt of Congress
entries.description: The key Trump ally refused to co-operate with a probe looking into the 6 January 2021 US Capitol riot.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England v France sees 'friendships on hold'
entries.description: "Friendships will be put on hold" when England host France in their second World Cup group game on Saturday.

entries.title: Penny Mordaunt to stand for Tory leadership
entries.description: The Commons leader says she is running to "unite our country" and win the next general election.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Balbirnie says Ireland's West Indies win 'our best' day in T20
entries.description: Captain Andrew Balbirnie describes Ireland's T20 World Cup win over two-time champions West Indies as the team's greatest day in the format.

entries.title: Iran: Climber Elnaz Rekabi apology was forced, source says
entries.description: Elnaz Rekabi had said her hijab fell off by mistake, but a source says she was threatened to say so.

entries.title: How long does a Premier League manager's job last on average?
entries.description: After Aston Villa sacked Steven Gerrard just 11 months into the job, BBC Sport asks: How long does a Premier League manager last on average now?

entries.title: Courtney Lawes: Northampton forward will not join up with England in Jersey
entries.description: Courtney Lawes will not join up with the England squad in Jersey next week as he continues to recover from concussion.

entries.title: Simona Halep: Former world number one provisionally suspended for doping offence
entries.description: Two-time Grand Slam champion Simona Halep is provisionally suspended from tennis after testing positive for a banned substance.

entries.title: Spain lifts final Covid rules for UK travellers
entries.description: British holidaymakers will no longer have to provide Covid or vaccination status to get into Spain.

entries.title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton faces Leicester Riders' Patrick Whelan and Blake Bowman
entries.description: Chris Sutton takes on Leicester Riders duo Patrick Whelan and Blake Bowman to pick his winners and losers from this weekend's Premier League games.

entries.title: Leah Croucher: Body identified as missing Milton Keynes teenager
entries.description: Human remains were found with Ms Croucher's possessions at a house in Milton Keynes last week.

entries.title: Tesco raises meal deal price as food costs soar
entries.description: It is the first time in 10 years the popular lunch choice has gone up for all customers.

entries.title: Ian Baraclough: Northern Ireland manager sacked by Irish FA
entries.description: Northern Ireland manager Ian Baraclough has been sacked by the Irish FA after 28 months in charge.

entries.title: Ralph Lauren apologises after Mexico indigenous 'plagiarism' claim
entries.description: The fashion giant was accused by the wife of the Mexican president of copying indigenous designs.

entries.title: Boris Johnson, Rishi Sunak and Penny Mordaunt: Who are MPs backing?
entries.description: Conservative MPs have started declaring who they want to become Britain's next prime minister.

entries.title: Imran Khan: Former Pakistan PM barred from running for office for five years
entries.description: The former cricketer is disqualified following what he says is a politically motivated case.

entries.title: Travis Scott: Rapper privately settles Astroworld lawsuit
entries.description: A lawyer for the family of Axel Acosta has announced a "confidential" settlement has been agreed.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Scotland out after loss to Zimbabwe in Hobart
entries.description: Scotland are out of the T20 World Cup after a tense five-wicket defeat by Zimbabwe in Hobart.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Manchester United forward must face consequences, says Erik ten Hag
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says there "has to be consequences" after confirming Cristiano Ronaldo refused to come on as a substitute against Tottenham on Wednesday.

entries.title: Labour MP Christian Matheson resigns over sexual misconduct
entries.description: Labour MP Christian Matheson resigns after a parliamentary watchdog recommended he be suspended.

entries.title: Could Boris Johnson really make a comeback?
entries.description: The former prime minister is considering a return to Downing Street three months after being ejected.

entries.title: Netflix adds disclaimer under The Crown's trailer for series five
entries.description: The royal drama is described as a "fictional dramatisation" on YouTube, online and on Twitter.

entries.title: Calls for Liz Truss not to take yearly £115,000 as ex-prime minister
entries.description: As a former prime minister, Ms Truss would be able to claim the money for expenses for public duties.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky accuses Russia of plot to blow up dam
entries.description: Ukraine's leader wars of a "large-scale disaster" if Russia targets the Kakhovka hydroelectric plant.

entries.title: Flu comes early in England, with hospital cases rising
entries.description: Cases have climbed quickly in the past week, suggesting the season has already begun, say officials.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: England 'chomping at the bit' for opener against Afghanistan says skipper Buttler
entries.description: England are "chomping at the bit" ahead of their T20 World Cup opener on Saturday, says captain Jos Buttler, but have injury concerns over Chris Woakes.

entries.title: Baby bison born in Kent countryside
entries.description: The bison that were reintroduced to the UK as part of an ambitious rewilding project in Kent have had a calf.

entries.title: Taylor Swift: Midnights praised by critics despite lack of radio hits
entries.description: Critics praise the "fantastic songs" on Midnights, but some add there is "not a smash hit in sight".

entries.title: Paul Newman: Hollywood legend was so insecure, says daughter
entries.description: The Hollywood actor's lost memoir has been rediscovered and sheds light on the tortured star's life.

entries.title: Harry Dunn: Parents hoping to rebuild their lives after guilty plea
entries.description: The parents of Harry Dunn say they have "supressed and buried" their pain while seeking justice.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ireland beat West Indies to advance in Hobart
entries.description: Brilliant Ireland advance in the Twenty20 World Cup by dumping out two-time champions West Indies with a nine-wicket victory in Hobart.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Ireland's Paul Stirling hits 50 against the West Indies
entries.description: Watch the best shots from Paul Stirling's half-century as Ireland beat the West Indies by nine wickets to qualify for the Super 12 stage at the T20 World Cup in Hobart, Australia.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Growing Russia-Iran ties pose new dangers
entries.description: The conflict has driven them closer together in a way which could impact the world beyond Ukraine.

entries.title: UK economy hit as people shop less than pre-Covid
entries.description: It comes as government borrowing rose in September, according to the Office for National Statistics.

entries.title: Norwich couple living in their car for seven months in council house wait
entries.description: A couple live in their car and sofa-surf while waiting for Norwich City Council to find them a home.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England captain Marlie Packer thought she had been dropped
entries.description: Marlie Packer says it is a "massive honour" to captain England for the first time - but she initially thought she was getting dropped when head coach Simon Middleton shared the news.

entries.title: TikTok denies it could be used to track US citizens
entries.description: In response to a media report, the firm said it does not collect precise location data from US users.

entries.title: Fuel blaze engulfs Mexico railway and homes
entries.description: Dramatic video on social media shows a cargo train hurtling through the flames.

entries.title: Cost of living: 'Hard to eat proper food'
entries.description: Young people speak to Newsbeat about how rising prices are impacting the food they can eat.

entries.title: Cost of Living: The Norwich mother working five jobs to make ends meet
entries.description: Rebecca Kellaway is a waitress. And a carer. And has three cleaning roles.
